title: Hey Riot
body: I was wondering when/if we might be seeing a new tank sometime in the future, in particular, a tank that has an extremely high or even just moderately high skill cap. From what I've seen, almost every class has one or more of these types of champions. For assassins there are Ekko, Zed, and perhaps Katarina. For fighters we have things like Gangplank, Fiora, Camille, Yasuo and Riven. Mages have Ryze, Azir, Zoe, and perhaps Taliyah. Draven, Vayne, and Kalista all have high skill caps and are of the marksman class. Even supports, who some view solely as shield bots, contains champions like Thresh, Bard, Ivern, and maybe even Rakan. This leaves us with tanks. The most difficult tank/ highest skill cap one is Singed due to his very unique playstyle.   The next most difficult tanks it seems would be Galio, Shen, Poppy, and Ornn. But when thinking of these, none of them bring to mind something like Yasuo does for fighters, or Zed does for assassins. They just don't seem to have the outplay potential, difficulty, or mastery that certain iconic champions from other classes do. One big thing the four tanks have in common is their high impact ults which seems to be the only thing making them more difficult than any other tank. To end this, I know some of this is simply opinion and not actually factual but feel free to disagree and say why in the comments.

replies.body: You're not wrong, interesting challenge for you: Why not prototype a tank you'd think would do well as "the next tank". It seems like an interesting exercise to make a tank on Singed's level of unique playstyle. Certainly got me curious.

I'm thinking a mobile tank would be cool, but not one that deals damage. But rather an initiator who soaks up damage. I think he should be a slim but strong character, but the design and background of the champion is up to you guys since I'm not very good at that. Here it is:

-      For his main source of CC he can have a zone in front of him that roots enemies for a second, I don't think this should be too long or a powerful cc like a knockup or a stun since that makes it too difficult to play against and considering his ult (paragraph 4) it'd be way too strong. 
 - This gives him the desired cc in a tank. The shape is up to you guys and I think this should be his Q.

-    He can have an ability that he can cast on allies or himself, one that gives a little bit of flat armor (ONLY flat if helping an ally) and a small shield. If placed on himself I think the buff should scale with his own armor and mr since he'll be soaking up the damage. 
 - The ability definitely shouldn't have % Damage reduction because I find that to be super strong and definitely not something that can easily be placed on an adc to negate damage. This way it makes him and his teammates tankier while allowing him to be. This can be his W.

- This ability is crucial to making him a mobile tank, he can blink to any point around an enemy target, just like Katarina's E, not an area or an ally because then he'd be too good at escaping considering he is already a tank. 
 - Having % damage reduction on outgoing damage from him after he blinks would be a great way to keep him from becoming a tanky + mobile fighter which would be extremely unfun to play against.... {{champion:77}}  The blink ability can be his E.

-   And his ultimate... This one is a bit difficult and maybe a bit of a stretch so do whatever you think should fit his playstyle but I'm considering an ability where he places a small wall in a direction and dashes straight towards the wall, pushing anyone in his way into the wall with him and stunning them briefly. 
 - I was considering knocking them up or aside but that didn't seem too impacting to me, this way his ult can a very strong initiation. The stun shouldn't be long though, around .5 seconds is fine since any longer would make him too strong considering his other abilities.


Combos: He can use his E to position himself around targets, and Q them for the root, his W is versatile since he can choose to either soak up the damage or defend the backline. 
His ult can be combined with his E to go deep into the enemy team and bring the backline to his team, and then his Q to keep them in place, grouped up, allowing for his team's AoE abillities to be extremely effective during that brief window.

Thats certainly an interesting idea, but I'll pose a counter question to the premise of "mobile tank". If a tank is mobile, is it doing its job of being a tank? 

Mobility usually implies "hard to hit", and if a tank is hard to hit than is it doing its job? Curious to hear your thoughts on this one XD

> [{quoted}](name=Bazerka,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=b6cEs5H1,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2018-07-02T23:42:20.475+0000)

> 
> Mobility usually implies "hard to hit", and if a tank is hard to hit than is it doing its job? Curious to hear your thoughts on this one XD

Good point...
Having mobility to dodge enemy abilities isn't what a tank should be able to do, normally a tank would be the one soaking up all the abilities so they don't affect their teammates. In my eyes, a mobile tank can jump into the enemy team to disrupt them, forcing them to use their abilities on him or risk being constantly cc'ed or being caught out somehow. Afterall, that's what tanks already do, the champion wouldn't be using the mobility to escape, but rather to initiate and threaten the enemy team with CC instead of damage. Being mobile allows him to be a threat to any of the enemy champions, no matter where in the teamfight he happens to be positioned. Instead of always trying to soak up abilities, he'd also be trying to direct them at him instead of his teammates.

Considering what you said, his E would have to have a short cooldown, and his W would have to be more powerful but only directed at himself. 

And I'm glad you found my idea interesting! lol

Wow, I'll admit, I wasn't exactly expecting a reply from a red but thank for it none the less. To me, it seems like the way to make a tank into a high skill cap champion would be to make what tanks do best, ta(n)king damage, different somehow. Right now they can't force someone to click on them or aim spells at them. The threat of either their damage or cc is the only thing making them the focus if other more high priority targets are in range like the ADC or Mid Laner. Also, I think I'll give your challenge a shot although I've never actually created a champion before.

I always thought a reactive tank would be cool, and we don't really have a champ that interacts with other champs' abilities, so what about an anti-projectile tank? Some kind of mage or technomancer (we don't have a "magic" tank) that's obsessed with magnetism?

For their passive... maybe they can block projectiles for teammates by stepping in the way (like, they get pulled to their armor or something), and maybe they can store charges per so much damage absorbed to empower other abilities.

For their Q, I would think just some bolt of energy, maybe it could use the stored up damage from the passive to pierce targets or do extra damage. Or maybe landing the Q could give charges instead, and power other abilities.

For their W, what about a grappling beam like Samus' from Metroid? They fling it out, and if it connects they could yank someone in, or take a page from Pyke and make tapping it push while holding pulls in? Maybe charges could have it affect more targets in the immediate area.

For their E, what if they jump to an area and magnetize the ground, dealing some damage and magnetizing the ground, slowing champs in the area? Maybe with charges they could pull nearby enemies to them.

For their ult, I could imagine them shooting some kind of energy bomb that absorbs all other projectiles it passes through (or give it a little AoE), and it lands and explodes, dealing damage based on how much damage it took, and maybe applying a stun if it absorbs a CC projectile (or maybe it could just apply the effect of whatever it picks up, and not have any damage on its own). Maybe the stored charges from the passive could increase the AoE of the projectile draw, or make it have a pull to the center of the explosion.

I like that there is interaction but I was thinking of counter play, such as if you throw a skill shot out to kill someone, and the tank is standing close to them and takes the spell, does it feel cheap or is it something more like an outplay?

I know, I was not challenged, still I'd like to try...

Spectre - The Ghostly Shield

Passive: Spectral Energy
When Spectre is taking damage, she gains 10 energy stacks for every 1% health, she lost, for 5 seconds. Taking damage refreshes the duration of the stacks.
When Spectre is using an ability, she consumes 200 energy stacks, if possible, making the ability being cast instantly.
Spectral Energy can stack up to 1000.

Q - Sword and Shield
Cooldown: 9 seconds
Range: 300 units
Spectre gain bonus armor and magic resistance for 2 seconds. After casting 1 second, she deals damage, scaling with ability power, to all nearby enemies and gains 10 energy stacks for every enemy she hits and 25 energy stacks for every enemy champion, she hits.
Gaining 200 energy stacks from taking damage, after using the ability, resets the cooldown of the ability.
Cannot act while casting.

W - Shift
Cooldown: 18/17/16/15/14 seconds
Range: 450 units
Spectre marks a location (300 unit diameter) and gains crowd control immunity for 1 second. After casting 1 second, she teleports to the center of the marked location and taunts enemies at the marked location for 1/1,25/1,5/1,75/2 seconds. She also deals damage, scaling with ability power, to taunted enemies.
Cannot act while casting.

E - Protect
Cooldown: 18/16/14/12/10 seconds
Range: 600 units
Cast on self: Builds a shield on Spectre over 1 seconds, while casting 1 second, blocking an amount of damage, scaling with her ability power. The shield remains for 4 seconds (duration beginning, when she is starting to cast) and heals Spectre for 75% of the remaining value, when the duration ends.
Cast on ally: Spectre builds a shield on target ally over 1 second, while casting 1 second, blocking damage (60% of the shield, she would cast on herself), then affects the targeted ally with Protection for 4 seconds. 50% of the damage, up to a maximum, received by targets, affected by Protection, is redirected to Spectre.
Cannot act while casting.

R - Spectral Shroud
Cost: Always costs 200 energy stacks.
Cooldown: 2 seconds
Spectre becomes invulnerable for 0,75/1/1,25 seconds and blocks projectiles. (that enter her hitbox)

So the abilities have an effect, that starts, when she starts casting the ability and another effect, when she has finished casting the ability. With 200 energy stacks, both effects will trigger at the same time. (E will give the shield instantly, instead of growing it over 1 second)

She is a mediocre pusher.
She has an initiation tool, that is similar to Shen's and can jump over walls.
She offers support to carries in teamfights.
She is tanky.

I realized, I could write some description to the champion.

Normally, Spectre has low mobility, because her abilities have a 1 second cast time. This disadvantage can be lowered, when she is taking damage.
She doesn't have mana.

She is played rather defensively in lane.
Her Q is her pushing ability, gives her the possibility to gain energy when she isn't taking much damage and can be used to gain a short defensive boost in fights.
She can make trades with WQ and heal herself with E.
Since she doesn't have mana, she can use E on cooldown, which gives her a lot of sustain.
This is a big advantage, but her big disadvantage is, that it's hard to hit an enemy with W.

She isn't really good at initiating, but she can protect her teammates in teamfights with E and R, soak up damage and has a reliable cc with her W, when she has some energy.

Especially later in the game, she has to make tough decisions how to use her energy.
Since her R can block projectiles, players have to take extra care of positioning.

She is a blueish ghost and glows yellow, when she is casting an ability.

Edit:

When Spectre is taking damage, she fills her energy bar by 1% for every 1% health, she lost.  When not taking damage for 5 seconds, she loses 1% of her maximum energy every seconds.
When Spectre is using an ability, she consumes 20% of her maximum energy, if possible, making the ability being cast instantly.

Q - Sword and Shield
Range: 200

E - Protect
She only heals for 50% of the remaining shield at the end of the duration.

R - Spectral Shroud
Cost: Always costs 20% of maximum energy.
Cooldown: 2 seconds
Spectre becomes invulnerable for 0,75/1/1,25 seconds and blocks projectiles. (that enter her hitbox)
Spectre generates energy from damage blocked in this time equal to 25% of the energy, she would get, if the damage wasn't blocked.

> in particular, a tank that has an extremely high or even just moderately high skill cap.

Apparently, that's Ornn.

When they removed unstoppable from his W, people complained that it was lowering his skill cap. Meddler replied that it's not a problem, because Ornn skill cap was too high, Ã  la Ryze/Azir with too wide a gap between high and low MMR, and that it's the highest skillcap of all Tanks in the game.

it's hard to create a tank that's high skillcap due to the forgiving nature of building defense rather than offense. I'm not saying it's impossible, but their mistakes are naturally forgiven more than a carry champ's mistakes.

I hadn't thought of that. I wonder if Pyke is something worth taking a look at for a tank? He can build defense items but still gets offensive stats from any bonus Hp.

I like the idea of creating a tank that is skill expressive. I actually tried creating a concept not too long ago for one. https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/1TpuJTOF-the-greatest-champion-concept-ever-kaktus-the-tag-playing-cactus
The skill is all about hitting the Water Gun ability to get the cc off and in order to basically do that you need to land a seed on the target, so it takes two abilities in order to cast cc on the target. Also I wasn't taking the champ too seriously. But you are welcome to use some of my ideas for abilities or evolve them a little. Good luck with creating a concept
